text: Fles, gekocht bierfestival Nijmegen Valkhof. Mooi licht bier, witte kraag. Sterke IPA met lichte afdronk. Uitstekend van smaak.
Turbid bronze colour with a big, dense head. Pretty sweet with orange marmalade, some coriander, and a hoppy bite.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, wheat, orange, hops, citrus and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque pale yellow/yellow beer with a slight/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, wheat and orange; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops, citrus and spices.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Thanks to the loads of orange peel and coriander, together with a bucket full of hops; this could truly be called a great Witbier.

courtesy of Antonio Rey - light hazy golden-yellow beer with a modest head retention; pungent aroma of oranges and citrus marmalade, strawberries; full-bodied, solid yet subtle carbonation; fairly bitter and a bit sourish; clean and very tasty; light estery finish with some residual sugars and long tones of yellow fruits - gently wheaty
Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma is a bit fruity with some grassh, hops and yeast. Taste has quite some yeast, grass and a medium bitter finish. Medium body and carbo.
Pale golden color, white head, medium lasting. Aroma is floral with yeasty notes. Flavor is slightly bittery, flowery notes with a light citrusy hints and some wheat. fresh final with yeasty notes.

A small taste from wiosna (tap) @ Delirium Cafe Amsterdam. Pours slightly cloudy golden with a high head. Aroma is sweet grainy malts with some wheat and fruit. Flavor is sweet malts, alcohol, wheat, some yeast and hops. Decent.

Los nice, yellow golden. Pale malts, lemon citrus aroma, crisp. But more interesting than my description. Almost Brett like. Light body with sharp yet pleasant carbonation. Taste bitterness throughout. Not the most complex taste, bit summery for sure. Not really a typical IPA, but a nice golden ale. (33cl bottle from Etre Gourmet)

(BIIR White IPA) Tap at MOUTbierfestival, Nijmegen, 150 ml
Hazy body, pale yellow in colour, with a tall and thick white head on top, good retention.
Aroma of wheat, citrus, light floral notes.
Taste is nicely bitter with citrus, floral notes, lemon leaves.
Medium thin body with good carbonation.
Nice one.

Sweet aroma with orange, lemon and generally citrusy hoppy with some floral notes and some sweet cereals. Light yellow color lightly cloudy with amazing dense head that lasts. Flavor is light sweet and medium bitter with botanical, lemon, pepper and citrus mainly but with added spice notes. Aftertaste is strong with mainly citrusy hoppiness and lasting, yeah its an IPA... Medium bodied with light carbonation plus crisp. Amazing brew.

. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied. Strong zesty citrus and good bitterness, very crisp and refreshing. Excellent hoppy fruity Wit.
33cl bottle. Citrus, subtle bretty notes, orange, coriander, floral hops and some nice red fruit notes. Probably the best witbier I have ever had, to date.
Pours hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma is citrus, orange peel, hops, grass, some resin. Taste is fresh, floral, strong grapefruit, some resin, grass. Very interesting!

Draught at Delirium Cafe, Amsterdam on 25-Apr-2016. Cloudy pale amber colour with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, floral pine and wheat. Medium body and carbonation. Slightly bitter fruity flavour. Barley, malt, orange peel Light bitterness, but slightly oversweet. Nice hoppy fruity Wit, but best sipped..

330ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Clear pale gokden color. Small size, white head, stays. Orange, marmalade, wheat, sweet in aroma. Fruity, citrus, wheat, sweet in taste. Sweet, citrus and fruity in aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Harsh hops. Weird one.

330ml bottle (alko Arkadia, Helsinki)
Sweet fruit, tropical fruits. Sticky palate, sickly palate, only saved by carbontion that is perhaps too high. Taste is soapy. Pretty rough. Fizzy. Mess.

Bottle shared by Phil. Slightly hazy yellow beer, white head. Nose is citric, grass, mango, hops. Flavor is toasty hops, wheat, oranges, peaches. Peachy finish, some sweetness, mild grapefruit, some bitterness.
From 2d2despuma. In Teku glass. Playing South Park Stick of Truth. Very drinkable. The glass emptied quickly, leaving my wanting more. Hoppy wit with some pleasant fruityness

Bottle at home. Aroma is zesty citrus peel, coriander, lemon peel, yeast, floral notes, hoppy, wheat. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied. Strong zesty citrus and good bitterness, very crisp and refreshing. Excellent hoppy fruity Wit.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21B - White IPA). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: predominant blend of citric hop aroma (grapefruit) with orange, some coriander and a slight sweet malty background, APPEARANCE: pale gold color and slightly hazy. moderate white head with average retention. TASTE: hop flavor with notes similar to aroma (grapefruit) and also slight orange and lemony coriander and some spicy notes. high bitterness with a medium-dry and bitter finish. PALATE: meidum-light body with moderate carbonation. no astringency. OVERALL: a very nice hybrid from an American IPA and a Witbier.
Bottle. Hazy, yellow-straw color. Aroma: citrus, coriander, wheat, noticeable hop character. Taste: orange and peel, grapefruit, coriander, pleasant hop bitterness, very original and pleasant,

On tap at Delirium Cafe, Amsterdam. Sweet and bitter orange aroma with pungent pineapple hops and faint, sweet pilsner malt. Cloudy dark yellow under persistent, large white bubbles and wisps. Sweet pilsner malt flavour behind bitter pineapple and orange. Resinous hops linger in the finish. Medium light body, moderate carbonation, crisp from the bitterness and lightish body.

0,33l fles van melgers gedeeld met jort sherla en bryan. Witgeel met een witte kraag. Geur is wat muf mout, Citrus in tweede instantie. Smaak brandnetelthee met citroen. Ook al was deze nog een aantal maanden houdbaar, toch leek het of hij al erg op zn retour was.

Une très belle blanche à la robe trouble, fine mousse. Nez complexe où lon retrouve des écorces dagrumes, de la coriandre, une note citronée, et une pointe de houblon frais. Bouche alliant fraîcheur, tension, fruit, fine amertume et finale sur le agrumes. Un délice tout en fraîcheur et complexité.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Muy buena. IPA de trigo, con bastante sabor y muy bueno a lúpulo. Medio cuerpo. Muy fresca

Alone at home. Hazy blond colored beer with large white head and lots of carbonation. Hopped floral aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped bitter sweet fruited.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
33cl bottle from etre gourmet. Cloudy light gold. Thin white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Aroma is herby, hoppy, citric.

On tap at Delirium Cafe, Amsterdam. Body is hazy yellow peach, head is big, white, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is fruity, apple, flavor is floral, yeast, fruity, lemon peel. Medium sweet, light hoppy bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is long lasting hoppy medium bittersweet, developing hoppy bitterness. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Easy, tasty fruity IPA.

hazy pale yellow colour, moderate sized white head; aroma and taste of a mixture of a citrusy-fruity IPA, a saison (with leather, barnyard and earthy notes) and a witbier (lemony-wheathy notes); good beer
Dorado lechoso y turbio con espuma blanca ligera. Aromas ligeramente achampanados, toque de cilantro, manzana verde, menta. Cuerpo ligero, sabor de fruta verde ligera acidez fresca y final seco.

bottle, BB 10.04.17 (from Koht). Pours yellow with huge white head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, floral, fruits, grass, honey, spices. Flavor is sweet and bitter, floral, soap, grass, spices, citrus. Finish is grassy-grapefruity-soapy bitter. Feels light but not watery. Overall: very nice.

Bottle at home. Smell of citrus, hops and yeast when opening the bottle. Sweet malts, grassy, scallion, dough, yeast, spices. Light sweet, sweet/sour, pinch of saltiness, bitter. Bitter finish. Body is medium.

Bottle at home. Hazy light golden with fizzy white head. Apricot, honey, peach, grapefruit, vanilla cake dough, lemon, coriander, light herbs. Under medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with sticky doughy feel. Quite nice.

Flaske 330ml. Gave fra Cristina & Pau. Lys appelsinfarget. Veldig uklar. Middels høyt skum som daler sakte & etterlater tett lacing. God appelsinaroma. Smaken er grapefrukt. Litt tørr. Frisk. Blir friskere og friskere etter hvert. Uvariert.
Van de tap @Delirium. Mooie mix tussen belgisch witbier en een IPA. Zoetig, fris, hoppig, citrus. Lekker.

Belle Biere le maltage est présent et met en place le houblonnage fin et délicat.
Belles bulles, un grand plaisir à la boire

Shared a bottle with Patrick and Lennart at my home 3-10-2015. Nice beer, a bit like Mr.Rock that we had in the Ardennes and in the train back from Beergeeks @ struise. Very fresh, quite some taste. Okay.
@ grave beer festival: Medium white head golden coloured body, fruity hops yeast malts smell, medium carbonation medium high bitter, sweet some pine like taste
Golden with a large white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, spice, wheat and malt. Taste is bitter and mild sweet. Body is medium, texture is thin and carbonation is average.

BIIR White IPA 6.8% A Barcelona Craft Beer pick up at Hopduvel in Gent. It turns out this was brewed in Belgium @ Anders in collaboration with Ginther Bensch. New world hops and U.S. IPA fused with a belgian wit. It pours an ultra-pale cloudy gold, too light more like a lemonade. The aroma is a ton of orange and some bready wheat spiciness. Not all that IPA like so far. Very spritzy rough carbonation like an aggressive seltzer. The taste is bitter lemon rind, some wit yeast character and a harsh hoppiness. WTF? Fail.

Bottle @ home. Hazy pale yellow colour with a medium sized whitw head. Smells hops, fruity, fresh, slightly yeasty, quite nice. Tastes bitter, hops, Belgian yeast, very fresh and refreshing, slightly zesty. Medium body, crisp feel, medium carbo.

33 cl bottle. BBE 18.12.2016.
Pours hazy pale golden color with a medium sized white head. Lemon and floral hops on the nose, some yeast, mild hops, faint wheat notes and maybe some soapy notes. Wheat flavor, citric fruits, yeast and faint spices. Refreshing Witbier with a mild hoppy kick. Decent.
2334

33cl bottle. cCloudy golden pour with thin white head, fair amount of lacing. Aromas of citrus, fresh toast and herbs. Taste sharply bitter, aggressive, balanced and fresh. Low carbonation and , oily palate. Aftertaste is short and bitter with really dry finish. Well-crafted beer, interesting and tasty stuff.

Cloudy golden beer with a white head, medium carbonation.
I taste delicious hop bitterness, fruity, malt, orange and little bit of coriander.
Little bit of white beer and a lot of IPA.
Long bitter aftertaste, nice.

33cl bottle. Hazy pale yellow colour with a thin white head. Citrus, fruits, coriander and yeast in the aroma. Average carbonation and light to medium body. Taste is bitter and dry with some spicy notes. Overall, a nice beer.

sample at 24 uurs maastricht. poured an light coloured blonde colour with a white head. notes of wheat, citrus, grains, coriander, orange peel, crisp malts, metallic notes, quite flat, refreshing wheat notes in the end, spiced yeast, ok
15cl taster @ de 24uurs van Maastricht. Nicely cloudy yellow, white foamy head. Citrusy nose along with some nicely creamy, witbier malts and yeast. Dry and refreshing. Low carbonation, thick body.
Bottle at home. Light yellow pour, thin white head. Aroma of spicy hops, citrus, lemon peel and somewhat herbal. Flavor is very bitter, dry, spicy and with a thick body. A bit off balance.
Sweetish IPA with lots of tropical fruit. Its predominantly an IPA, I dont taste the witbier. Nice, but not special.
Troebel wit, mooi vol schuim. Ruikt grappig. IPA met nog iets. Lekkere smaak, vooral IPA.
Geel ondoorzichtig met een mooie witte schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, tropisch fruit. Smaakt tropisch fruit, citrus.

33cl flesje via Firma Bier
Alcoholpercentage van 6,8%
Uitgeschonken in Hoegaarden glas

Uiterlijk: lichtblond met luchtige schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: fris en fruitig van citrus, bitter als grapefruit, kruidig van de koriander 

Conclusie: niet verkeerd deze combinatie van witbier en IPA


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On Tap, @V Festival Birrasana. Blanes. 01/05/2015 
Color amarillo turbio, espuma blanca, aromas frutales. Parece más una ipa que una witbier.

10cl sample at the Zythos Beer Festival (Leuven, April 25th 2015). An odd fellow, this one. Its an untypical whitebeer with lots of hops. And above all, a brilliant beer: great hops, great wheat taste, great ending.
with bart in Kulminator hazy white gold blond colored body with a white head and a spicy yeast hop aroma a spicy hops yeast fruity dry bitter taste with a bitter finish
Bottle at a big tasting. Light smell, fruity with some light spices. Similar taste. Light, not like a white IPA. Not very exciting.

@BFGM, gedeeld met een Franse mafklapper die durde te beweren dat het een Frans bier was... yeah right...dude.... volgens mij werd het tijd om deze gast de tent uit te sturen,.... oogde bleek wit/gelig met witte kraag. aroma van tarwe, citrus, koriander. Smaken evenzo. en vooralsnog niet erg bijzonder.... denkt dat deze s zomers op een terras prima te doen is. maar valt nu wat tegen..

I had high expectations because of the high rating on RB. The tasting resulted in a slight disappointment. Very drinkable, mildly bitter but no specific fruit to be recognized. Orange? Not in my glass...
Pours pale gold with white head. Aroma is wheat and citrus. Flavour is citrus, medium bitter and wheat.

33cl bottle
Appearance: Hazy pale light golden with a 2 finger sized white head. 
Aroma of wheat, light hops, malts, coriander seeds. 
Taste: Starts malty sweet, light bitter but there are some orange peel citrus tones from the hops Some coriander. Yeat and esters in the finish. 
Problem is the hops are to subtile to label it IPA. A nice Hoppy Belgian white fits beter.Also the full palate is not fully balanced out. 
medium body, average carbonation.

Nice idea, but not delivering it completely. Still above average.
En botella. Amarillo turbio, con espuma blnca. Hierba fresca, algo de fruta. Seca, carbonatación medio alta. Muy agradable

Hazy pale white golden colour, white head. Aroma of wheat, light hops, malts, coriander seeds. Malty flavour, hops, light bitter, orange peel, coriander. Finish wheat and yeast notes. Above average witbier.(from draught @ ZBF 2014, Leuven)

Tarwedubbel inspired by IPA, in fact a hybrid between the two, is claimed on the label. Hazy golden blonde under a moussy, lacing, fairly stable, egg-white head. Aroma is very Belgian (fruity esters), which in itself is far from a bad thing, but admittedly I had expected (a lot) more C-hops; I get impressions of mango, orange, lime juice and perhaps milk gone sour, some canned tomato, bell pepper, banana, tulips, mandarin liqueur, red apple peel, raspberries, raw rhubarb (acetaldehyde), freshly cut grass and, unfortunately, a faint touch of sewer water which - luckily - fades away completely after a while. Estery taste, a bit soapy, banana cream, apple, sour white grapes, candied orange, vanilla, medium and minerally carbo, smooth mouthfeel, sweetish with clear wheaty and yoghurty sourishness, bready malt backbone underneath, phenolic spiciness retronasally, drying finish more from persisting carbonation than anything else, yeasty and combining sweetness from the fruity esters with wheaty sourishness, with an emphasis on the first; hop bitterishness is there, but remains very limited and basic and not IPA-like in the least; in fact, the initial sweetness, though not cloying at all and remaining restrained, is the last impression. A lingering estery and soapy sweetishness dominates the finish. I had a few American white IPAs: this is nowhere close to it. This is another Belgian ale, not the worst in its kind at all, but nowhere near the (if any) standard Id expect from something which calls itself a white IPA. This is not a hybrid between witbier and IPA: this is a witbier with slightly above average ABV and slightly above average hop dosage, something which has been in existence for a few decades and should be labelled tarwedubbel, nothing more, nothing less. Bit disappointed, actually.
Hazy yellow color with huge head. Aroma is citrus, yeast. Flavor is coriander, yeast, bitter.

33cl bottle. Bbe 02/06/2016. Pours cloudy golden, thick creamy white head. Perfume, yeasty, floral aroma. Grapefruity bitter flavor , orange, Belgian yeast. Dry finish. Refreshing brew indeed. High drinkability.
Veel minder dan verwacht, gek bittertje, beetje zeperig, Saison achtig. Niet slecht maar ook niet goed-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Yellow, clear. Quickly receding head. Strong hoppy aroma. Piney and citrusy. Fairly thick texture. Hoppy and bitter with some herbal undertones.
Bottle. Blonde. Soft spicy citric perfumed aroma. Lots of coreander in the grassy citric soft hopbitter flavor. Lots of flavor, buit somewhat out of balance.
Bottle, pours hazy light yellow with a white head. Aroma: grass, coriander, orange peel. Taste: citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruits, spices. Lovely!

Bottle, BBE 02/10/16. Pours a hale yellow with a large, thick, white head. Aroma is lemon, lime, strong coriander. Taste is a huge wallop of fruit: Lime, grapefruit, lemon. Especially grapefruit is very strong. Sweet and fresh fruit. Delicious. Fairly full with fairly strong carbonation. Gorgeous.

Bottle at home. It pours lightly hazy pale gold with a thick, foamy white head. The nose is soft, fruity, fragrant, orange, tangerine, sherbet, doughy, cracker and coriander. The taste is crisp, smooth bitterness, doughy, orange rind, lemon, herbal, grass, sherbet and a touch of alcohol with a dry finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Fruity and rather easy going. Not bad.

This is a fusion of a Belgian Wheat and an IPA. And it definitely combines both styles. Youll get the sparkle of an Wheat (and even more), some orange peel notes and a glance of koriander. And youll get the hop army from the Ipa side of this beer with its citric body and an ultra dry finish that could last longer. Interesting.
Imagine it is summer in Barcelona. And you love Belgian Whet Beers and IPAs. But you cant decide which one to take. Well, BIIR takes this decision for you: both in one!
@ Bierkaai A white creamy head. Spicy aroma, citrus, lemon peel. Taste is spicy and hoppy. Very Really nice one.
Een heerlijk verfrissend bier, mooi in balans. Juiste citrus tonen en mooie hop aroma. Smaakt echt naar meer
From draft at BIIR day at Beercap very refreshing beer with lots off citrus tones what i very like in a hoppy beer good brewed

Bottle, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond/white beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: lemon, wheat, fresh.
TASTE: little hoppy, wheat, some lemon maybe. Decent in general.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Shmupi. Pours yellow hazy with a medium head, aroma of wheat, bubblegum, hops, flavor of wheat, bubblegum, hops, slightly bitter, medium bodied.

Keg @Asturies Summer Beer Festival 2014, Gijón.23-08-2014.
Pours hazy pale golden with frothy white head. Long head retention, some lacing. Citrusy and herbal aromas.Light body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste follows the nose. moderate bitterness.
On tap at Délirium Café Amsterdam. Pours white, yellow with a white creamy head. Spicy aroma, citrus, lemon peel. Taste is spicy and hoppy. Really nice one.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Shmupi. Hazy blond, white head. Floral blossom aroma, a little tarty, fruity taste. Relatively light body, mild floral finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Shmupi. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of coriander, orange and some hops, somewhat stale. Sweetish and slightly souirish flavor of coriander, oranges and a bitter finish. Medium-bodied. Like a somewhat hoppy Witbier.
Bonita espuma, color amarillo pálido. Muy aromática, naranja, hierba, cítricos, trigo... En boca es fresca, con sabor a cítricos, hierba, trigo, amargor... Una cerveza equilibrada.

Draft @ London Craft Beer Festival 2014. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy grassy hoppy aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy grassy flavor. Has a fruity spicy grassy hoppy finish.

13.12.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh, citrus peel, yeast, weeds, light malts, grass, wheat, orange, spices, paper. Taste is slightly harsh, weeds, alcohol, citrus peel, yeast, sugar, wheat, spices, medicine, grass. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh mouthfeel. Not my cup of tea.
Poured hazy light orange with a huge, frothy white head. Aroma of bittersweet orange and light malt. Medium body, flavour of orange, grapefruit, mango and bitter hops. The bitterness lingers.

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale yellow beer with a reasonable sized bright white head on top. Aroma of lemon, citrus, light coriander. Flavor is moderately bitter, very refreshing. Light bitter aftertaste. Nice carbonation going on.

Thanks to Gunther for this bottle.
Pours a hazy pale yellow with a nice white creamy head. Aroma of hops and citrus. Flavors of strong citrus, hops and grains. Very refreshing, nice balance of flavors with a nice long fresh hop bitterness. long lasting bitterness in mouth. very much the white beer with the finishing of a good IPA. Great brew, highly recommended. Will buy and drink again.

On tap at Délirium Café Amsterdam. Hazy golden yellow colour, white head. Aroma is quite hoppy, tropical fruits, zest, grapefruit, spices, wheat, pineapple. Flavour is medium sweet, fruity, hoppy, tropical fruits, grapefruit, light sweaty, wheat, light spicy, firm bitter finish. Medium bodied, juicy. What youd expect from a white IPA.

On tap at delirium Amsterdam. Clear gold pour with thick frothy white head. Aroma is quite hoppy, grassy, leafy hop, light tropical fruits. Taste of sweet juicy hop, some bready wheaty notes, light bitterness, very easy drinking. Palate is light, light carbonation. Nice
Pues muy rica esta cerveza. Una mezcla muy bien hecha que tendré que tomar una vez al mes por prescripción médica.

Bottle 0.33l from De Hopduvel beer shop Ghent Belgium.Pour it hazy yellow colour.Taste and aroma of hops, spices, Belgian yeast.Wau what a taste . Between Belgian Ale and IPA.Perfect carbonation and complexed.I like it very very much.
Bottle. Golden-yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, coriander, malt, wheat. Flavour is citrus, coriander, malt, wheat, orange, yeast, hop, pine. OK/Nice beer.

Bottle 330ml. [ As BIIR White IPA ].Light unclear matt medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, moderate hoppy, citrus, moderate yeasty, soapy, spicy, pineapple, light coriander. Flavour is moderate sweet, light light acidic and moderate bitter with a average to long duration, pineapple tart, fruit, hoppy, yeasty, peppery. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20140517]

Bottle, bought @ Etre Gourmet. Pours pale yellow with a small, frothy, white head. Aroma has good apricot, coriander, wheat, grapefruit. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel with some graininess. Flavour has citrus, apricot, grapefruit, wheat, grainy. Lingering, pleasant bitterness. Lovely.
Bottle at The Drunk Monk, Mataro. Hazy, pale yellow. Fruity and grassy nose. Refreshing, yet solid grassy hop bitterness towards the finish. Interesting.

On tap.
II Summer Beer Festival, Gijón/Xixón.
In short: Sweet then hoppy beer.
Flavour fresh, fizzy and sweet at first, goes to a hoppy sour. Smell is flowery and hoppy. Incredible mixture of a witte and a soft IPA.

Caña en el festival de la cerveza se verano en gijon. 23-08-2014. Color amarillo pajizo con espuma blanca. Aromas bastante pronunciados al principio de lúpulos herbáceos y ligeramente afrutados que poco a poco van desapareciendo para quedar algo suave y dulce. No esta mal, para repetir.
Runder, stark gehopfter Antrunk. Fruchtig, rund, gelungene Hopfigkeit. Leicht säuerlich. Gut. 11/9/9/9//9
Large head, bit hazy. Aroma contains hops. Tastes like banana, very fruity. Light body, average carbonation.
Draft - Sweet lime citrus. Hazy gold with a bubbly white head. Carb bite, heavy citrus. Tastes like breakfast juice.

Draught at London Craft Festival, London. Cloudy pale yellow beer with a nice rich lasting white head. Wheat aroma, spice, glue, citrus, hay, floral notes, some grapes. Hoppy grassy flavor, hay, floral, spicy, grass, some caramel. Decent beer.
Keg. Very pale yellow, almost white, cloudy with a huge white head. Aroma is pineapple, lemon and orange. Body is medium, a good level of carbonation. Taste is soft lemon, light malt. Good.

From bottle 33 cl. 
Hazy yellow color, with white head. 
Aroma much fruits, (wheat)malts, yeast note. 
Medium body. 
Taste: sweet, malts, fruits, citrus..., nice bitterness.
GOOD ! Like this beer.

I dont get a lot of wheat aromas, but rather citrus and coriander. 
Some of creaminess of a wheat beer in the taste. The taste is sweet, bitter and hops.
Nice beer.

Huge, dense, just off-white head, over coldhazed, very carbonated yellow beer. Coriander, bit dullish rootspices, faintly aromatic. Huge head doesnt help the sniffing... Taste yields more coriander, with an additional bitterness, maybe hoppy, but not necessarily USA hosp. Finish is soapy-perfumed. Wheatslickness, quite velvety, despite the high carbonation. Gold medial for the 666th version of Belgian wit. Ugh.
Bottle 33cl A hazy golden colour with an off-white foamy head. An aroma of tropical fruits and spices. The taste is medium bitter.

Bottle from Prik en Tik Marlou in Zonhoven.
Taste herbs, malts, hops, strong citruss/orange. aftertaste dry, hoppy and a taste of zeste from an orange.
On tap at Birrasana. Slightly hazy golden colour with white head. Wheat, citric and spiced aroma. Wheat, bitter, fruity, citric taste. Medium body.

Bottle at America Strikes Back, Ulfborg. Pours hazy straw with airy white head. Clear, sourish aroma of grain and yeast, with notes of hops. Sweetish, malty flavour, with sourish, grainy and citric notes and bitter, hoppy touches. High carbonation. Lingering, bitter aftertaste. OK but a little to citric.

Bottle 330ml @ fonefan on the patio
Pours hazy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, citrus and orange. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
33 cL bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and light grapefruity. Smooth fruity. Light citrusy and crisp hoppy. Lingering peachy and light estery finish.

Slightly hazy with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast, citrus, spices and a little orange peel? Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, phenols, orange peel, pepper, spices, little sweet and medium bitter.

Hazy light yellow body with high white head. Aroma has citrus, grapfruit, light grassy, pine, light yeast, mango. Taste has high citrus bitterness, long lasting bitter after taste, medium to low malty sweetness. Body is full, medium carbonation. Well balanced.

Sample @ZBF 2014-ZA, thx to a merry ST247 for pushing this under my nose, entre autres... Obvious pink grapefruit nose and wit freshness delivers a fresh invitation to dig in. Taste topples from the perfumed and hop-fruity into slightly tart lemon peel, rubber, cheesy directions, but keeps afloat between the styles it seeks to merge. Enjoyable, dryish, with a fluffy-light feel to it considering its abv. To revisit bottled.
ZBF 2014: light fresh citrus aroma,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, very nice fruit and light hoppy fresh mango and ananas finish.
Zythos Festival 2014. Light yellow coloured and unclear. Has a white head, medium duration. Heavy hoppy aroma, mango, citrus, ananas. Flavor starts sweet and finish heavy bitter.
pale cloudy citrus dry good bitterness citrus peel chiara buona schiuma sentoti agrumati luppolate non momto corpo una lieve acidita buona intensita

15cl z kranu na Zythos BierFestival w Leuven.
Piwo jasne i lekko mętne. Aromaty drożdży o mocnych nutach cytrusów, marakui, skórek grejpfruta i kolendry. W ustach średnio gazowane i mocne. Gorzkie ale nie do przesady. Łatwe w piciu. Earlier Rating: 4/26/2014 Total Score: 3.715cl z kija na festiwalu Zythos. Jasne I mętne jak sok z cytryny. Aromat twarogu, kolendry i skórki cytrusów. Świerze i dobrze wyważone smaki. Umiarkowanie gorzkie i dosyć cierpkie na końcu. Super.
Il luppolo la fa da padrone in questa birra. Aromi floreali e citrici la caratterizzano. Il finale è lungo anche se leggermente astringente.
Trübs hellgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, bitter, grasig, trocken. Geschmack nach exotischen Früchten, trocken, bitter.

Hazy bright yellow-white coloured with a fading medium large white head. On the nose fruity aromas such as grapefruit, citrus some lemon hints develop. The taste is rather fresh with a light body and fruity bitterness with some sweet notes which fade quickly. Flavours of citrus fruits are predominant and the bitterness goes on and on with a long dry bitter finish which eventually gets a bit annoying.
Sample glass at ZBF 2014: hazy yellow beer, citrus aroma, taste citrus, fruit, zweet-bitter nice.
@ZBF. Pours white, yellow with a white creamy head. Spicy aroma, citrus, lemon peel. Taste is spicy and hoppy. Really nice one.

Flaska från Etre Gourmete. Disig, orangegul vätska med vitt skum. Doft av jäst som känns lite murrig, men den försvinner allt mer då ölet luftats. Gul och vit söt fruktdoft- och smak som växer då tempen stiger. Citrus, ananas, passiionsfrukt, lichi, päron. Medelstor beska, vetesyrligt frisk. Kanske kunnat vara någon procent svagare och utan jästiga biarmoer, annars riktigt bra.

From the tap at zythos. Super refreshing, lovely hoppy nose with orange-yeast undertones. Light body with nice hop/fruit flavor. Lemon notes too, with a mid to strong bitterness to finish. Nice and cloudy in the glass. Excellent.
9th April 2014Hazy gold beer, tidy white head. Palate is airy, fine carbonation. Airy malt, touch of cream. Pinch of spice before good tinned mango. Finishes light. Decent stuff.
Appearance is a a hazy straw color like that of a witbier, and a huge white head of foam. Retention is very good, staying a top the beer the majority of its life.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 Hazy gold color with white head, producing lacing down the entire glass. Nose is bright citrus. Medium-full bodied, well balanced with a short bitterness. This is delicious brew. I will buy this again.
Hazy yellow colour, white foam. Hoppy aroma with lots of tropical fruit and coriander. Nice bitter hoppy finish. Some sour notes. Easy drinkable and refreshing.
Pours a hazy golden yellow with a white head and aroma of citric hops, tropical fruit, and yeast. Taste is of hops, fruit, spices, yeast, coriander, lemon. Fresh.

33 cl bottle. POurs very hazy pale with a thin lingering white head. Aroma of citrus, mango and passion fruit. Very nice. Taste is again very fruity, particilarly tropicval fruits: mango and passion fruit. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. I enjoyed very much this "spanish" beer brewed in Belgium. Nice approach to the witbier.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Botella de 33 cl, en tienda XXXII. Color dorado. Sabor a lupulo, ligeramente citrico y amargo.

Bottle shared. Pour slight cloudy pale gold yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus, orange peel, coriander, and other fruits. Flavor is light sweet and moderate bitter. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation. Like a more hoppy wit.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin creamy white head. Not much bitterness. refreshing zesty taste. Cloudy white pour.
33cl bonica etiqueta. No es ni wit ni IPA pero te alguna cosa de les dues. Tot I la graduació es refrescant, cítrica. Ideal per una terrassa al sol un diumenge al migdia.

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, average to large and mostly diminishing head. Moderate malty  lightly wheaty lightly sweetish aroma, light tropical fruitiness, light citrus - grapefruit hopyness. Body is medium, malty  some wheat and lightly sweetish flavor, light tropical fruitiness, light citrus hoppyness. Finish is average, malty  some wheat and lightly sweetish, light fruitiness, light -some citrus hoppyness.

Comprada en 2d2dspuma. Una cerveza además cara. Buena capa de espuma, turbia. En aroma no se aprecia el trigo, y en boca muy poco. ARoma herbal y floral, carbonatación excesiva. Toques suaves de caramelo y cítricos, algo de lúpulo y un retrogusto corto y ligeramente amarga. Regular.

Botella de 33 cl.Color dorado palido vierte una espuma blanca poco persistente.En aroma se aprecia el lupulo froral, algo de trigo y cilantro.Cuerpo ligero un tanto aguado,se aprecian sabores amargos que recuerdan al pomelo, excesiva carbonatación.Final ligeramente amargo con notas picantes.
No me dice nada.No entiendo cómo está tan bien valorada.

33cl, new exclusive Spanish collab. brew Anno 2013 (brewed at Br. Anders), from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex bitter Belgian White, fruity/floral and slightly bitter/woody, balanced, cloudy, rocky head, good brew

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 Apariencia y espuma ajustada a su estilo, translúcida y de espuma blanca. El aroma es ligero a lúpulo poco fresco, no es para nada afrutado ni desde luego cítrico, como se supone que debería ser. De sabor está mejor, destaca el toque especiado propio del estilo. A mí me sobresale sabor a clavo aunque parece que no lo lleva. Algo más amarga de lo habitual en las witbier, es el único toque a "ipa" que le veo. Quizás no haya probado el mejor lote (BB: 06/01/2016) pero con el precio que tienen podrían tener mejor control de calidad. Si se valorase calidad / precio le bajaría un punto.

17/II/14 - 33cl bottle from Willems (Grobbendonk) @ home - BB: 27/VIII/15 (2014-202) Thanks to Beerlover_Ben for doing my groceries! :-)
Little hazy pale yellow beer, irregular white creamy head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: very fruity, quite some citrus, passion fruit. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: some citrus, pretty bitter, very fruity, pineapple, passion fruit, some mango. Aftertaste: nice bitterness, citrus, very fruity, pineapple, bit resinous. Would classify as an IPA rather than a Belgian Wit. Enjoyed this one very much!
Belga blanca con un toque de lúpulo, aunque no demasiado fresco. Muy bebible, un poco aguada incluso. Cítrica y con buen carbónico. No está mala.

Colocada en su primer día en el mercado como la mejor española según ratebeer, esta cerveza es el claro ejemplo de manipulación de rates. Solo hay que echar un vistazo a la mayoría de los usuarios que la votan cerca del 5. Una vez probada, para contrastar, nos encontramos con una cerveza regular; sobrecarbonatada, con sabor a lúpulo viejo y oxidación. De postgusto corto, se nota que ahorraron en lúpulo y malta, aguada. Eso sí, la etiqueta es bonita. Normalmente le pondría una nota algo más alta, pero el 1 está bien para compensar.
I was surprised by this new beer made near my town. Im hooked to it. Its orange flavour is delicious. The second production is bitter than the first but also superb

Tastada de barril i botella a The Drunk Monk. A diferència de molts cervesers, mencanten les cerveses de blat. Però les meves preferides són les destil IPA. Aquesta uneix els dos conceptes pel que penso que és una autèntica troballa. Ben elaborada, amb un aroma i un gust que aporten alguna cosa nova en el món de les cerveses de blat belga on semblava que tot ja estava dit. Molt bona feina Bensch i Biir.
on draft i BierCab Barcelona witbier surprising. citrus aromas and flavors of ripe tropical fruit. Foam spectacular. proper carbonation.
Bottle @ Willems Grobbendonk. Pours hazy orange with a small creamy head. Grapefruit, pepper, yeast, wheat and fruit. Smooth, dry and hoppy.

Bottle from Willems Grobbendonk, Hoppy beer whith taste of citrus flavors.
very creative, new and interesting. Congratulations

33cl de Willems, BB 27/08/2015. Not even sur why BIIR is entered as a client brewer? or why all the other clients of Anders are not entered as client brewers as well? BB 27/08/2015.
Dorée/paille, col épais blanc.
Arôme offre un nez qui garde, malheureusement, ce côté très belge assez noble dans les houblons. Note de blé, pointe dépices; coriandre qui se retrouve assez dominante le tout complété par qcq pointes de houblons verts voire citronnés.
Palais est agréablement houblonné; citronné avec ce profil gardant une inspiration de blanche. Retrouve une petite douceur orangée sur un fini râpeux et sec. Les houblons, au départ assez prenant, développent vite ce profil nobles typique avec ci et là qcq essences fruitées renforcées par lajout un peu outrancier de coriandre. Ce dernier ne parvient justement pas a distinguer cette bière qui se veut hybride du style. car trop présent.
Sur la fin, le houblon parvient finalement à se faire plus présent ajoutant une petite pointe agréable de fruité.
Le tout reste correcte, mais sans plus.


Au contraire des blanches italiennes qui innovent, cette version de Anders tombe un peu à leau.

(bottle, 33cl) Hazy, pale golden colour with a blond mid-sized foamy head. Grapefruity hoppy aroma with a mildly wheaty touch and a spicy, sweaty coriander notes. Mildly bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Wheaty malty taste with present fruity hoppy notes of grapefruit, also coriander and yeasty spicy notes; mildly bitter and delicately sour fruity finish with bearable spicy notes. 08.XI.13

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2014 Botella. Carbónico por un tubo, las levaduras presentes en aroma y sabor notas metálicas. No parece que tenga demasiado trigo poca acidez típica del trigo. Notas de oxidación en paladar. Amargor final y punto. Poco cuerpo, no aparenta los grados que tiene
Beautiful cloudy yelow with persistent white foam. Citric amd flower taste. Not agressive bitternes and alchool.

ivorywhite head disappears with some lacing. lemon-yellow slight turbid colour. aroma of hop, sulphur, citrus, grapefruit. taste like aroma, slight sour with a bitter aftertaste. medium body and carbonation. not bad at all.

Ampolla.
Aparença: bona presència descuma que es manté, térbola com totes les witbiers, color no tan pàlid com seria desperar.
Aroma: fresca, molt citrica i afruitada, aquest aroma va creixent.
Sabor: predominen els sabors citrics i de fruita dolça, el toc damargor està molt ben equilibrat. Els sabors et perduren en boca.
Una cervesa amb un molt bon equilibri on no desentonen el 6,8% dalcohol ni tampoc lamargor. Sha aconseguit una cervesa molt rodona, diria que és una de les millors cerveses de blat que he provat.
bottle in hotel room .. hazy yellow ... big white head ... soft zezty peppery hop ... soft floral fruits ... light zezty floral hop ... soft dry fruit finish

On tap @ OBAD Beer festival in Diest on 19/10/2013
White yellow, very mat color. Fruity nose, citrus, lemon and after a while a lot of yeast kicks in the nose. Taste is really exotic, tropical fruit with lots of mango. Has some spicy, slightly tinteling in the aftertaste. Very good IPA on overall, best beer I had so far from this brewery.
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 Bons aromes a llúpols i taronja. Cervesa tècnicament perfecte !!! Pel meu gust una mica massa de gas.
Bottle in Biercab Barcelona I like white beers for me the best white beer ever i tried so balanced and nice
Bottle from Willems Grobbendonk, I like a white beer and also a Hoppy beer and in the noise and taste the citrus flavors.

Tasted at drunk monk from bottle with some friends. Also on tap now. Color and high carbonation is good as a white should be. Dont expect an ipa ,neither a white as its a white ipa. Smells american hops,tastes really good. Its very easy drinking although its 7%ABV,so nice to share with your girl. Overall impressed with this fresh and different beer!

Sampled from bottle @ Borefts 2013 after tasting. Hazy yellow color, small to medium sized white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, lemon, some hops, slightly herbs, slightly citrussy. Not bad, not good either.

thnx to ships ! 
pours yellow, small white head. smells like a white. 
taste is also very much like a wheatbeer. dont get the IPA-thing here.. do find some peppery-notes .. realy intence, high carbo .

Procured from Willems. Split with several people. 33 cl. bottle sampled bottle @ hotel. First day @ Borefts 2013. New Anders contract brew made for something which is called Barcelona Craft Beer. No idea who those guys are or what is going on, surprised to fin a fresh White IPA in Belgium. Pours a very hazy citrus with a white head. Nose is coriander, big citrus, hazy citrus, fizzy wheat & nice hops. Taste is bitter coriander, bit sprizy, carb. is high. hay, noticeable citrus hops, USA hops, bitter hay, wheat, Bit too carbonated, overall pretty nice, nice brew.
